results.title: Barriers
results.brief_description: A group of young people discuss the problems a particular person has in relating in American Society. Unrehearsed, the film talks about such topics as racial conflicts, suspicion, gangs and the social/economic classes. No other credits available.

results.title: Barrier story
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the city and people of Broken Hill, situated on one of the richest silver, lead and zinc fields in the world. Emphasis is laid on the rapid development of Broken Hill into a modern mining community with all the facilities for pleasant living and recreation. There is wealth and security, social progress and industrial peace in the ‘Barrier City’.

results.title: Bargain basement
results.creator_credit: John Smith, James de B. Domville, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This fictional film focuses on the unexpected confrontation of an experienced shoplifter and a lonely store detective. She lifts one time too many, and he suggests they “talk it over” - in his apartment! Desperation drives people into strange situations. When finally they part, neither one of them will ever be quite the same again. Original story by Douglas Bowie. Starring Vladimir Valenta and Luce Guilbeault. Awards: Toronto; Mannheim; New York.

results.title: Bardell vs Pickwick
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Describes the trial for breach of promise and the many amusing moments which arise when Mr. Pickwick’s landlady interprets his discussion regarding the hiring of a man servant as a proposal for marriage. Introduced by Frederic March.

results.title: The Barber of Seville by Rossini
results.brief_description: Rossini’s comic opera, sung in Italian. One of a series of “opera-films”, which feature the chorus and orchestra and some of the principals of the Rome Opera House, La Scala, Milan, and other famous Italian opera companies; each film combines scenes from a performance of the opera with an english-language commentary which explains the plot and telescopes the action. Features Tito Gobbi as Figaro.

results.title: Banquet of life
results.creator_credit: James Murray and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Examines the challenge facing man from food shortages and over population in many parts of the world. Questions whether the solution lies in increased food productivity or in control of the birth rate. Much filming was done in Guatemala and Costa Rica.

results.title: Banksia Serrata
results.brief_description: One of a group of four films which looks at a species of native tree, growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. Sound is of a solo flute mixed with native bird calls. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.

results.title: Banksia Integrifolia
results.brief_description: Banksia intergrifolia: a species of native tree growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. Explores the patterns of the characteristic serrated leaves, then buds slowly maturing over many months into nectar-laden flowers. These slowly change to woody “Banksia men” cones. The sound track features a duet of two noisy Friars imitating a pair of Wattle Birds. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.
